meanings.definition: In a scruffy manner; untidily or shabbily.
meanings.sent1: He walked scruffily down the street, his shirt untucked and his hair messy.
meanings.sent2: She always looks scruffily dressed, with mismatched socks and wrinkled shirts.
meanings.sent3: The cat groomed itself scruffily, leaving patches of fur sticking out in odd directions.
meanings.sent4: The old book was scruffily bound, its pages worn and yellowed with age.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house stood scruffily at the end of the road, its windows boarded up and paint peeling.

meanings.definition: Wearing clothes that are scruffy or untidy.
meanings.sent1: The scruffily dressed man shuffled into the cafe, his pants torn at the knees.
meanings.sent2: She felt self-conscious in her scruffily patched jeans among the well-dressed crowd.
meanings.sent3: The scruffily attired clown tripped over his oversized shoes, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The scruffily dressed scarecrow in the field seemed to blend in with the ragged cornstalks.
meanings.sent5: The scruffily dressed students huddled together, sharing stories of their latest thrift store finds.
